channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-6564] HDFS space is not reclaimed when a column family is deleted
item.description: When a column family of a table is deleted, the HDFS space of the column family does not seem to be reclaimed even after a major compaction.
item.summary: HDFS space is not reclaimed when a column family is deleted

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Submitted a first patch for this on trunk

+    fs.delete(delDir, true);

Please check the return value from delete() call.

TestTableFamilyHandlers.java misses license header.


+   // TETS - Disable and delete the column family

'TETS' seems to be misspelled above.
Please add the following to the end of the new test:


  @org.junit.Rule

  public org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ResourceCheckerJUnitRule cu =

    new org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ResourceCheckerJUnitRule();

Please try the patch on a cluster.

Thanks

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12541485/HBASE-6564-trunk.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 7 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 javac. The applied patch generated 5 javac compiler warnings (more than the trunk's current 4 warnings).

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 8 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2614//testReport/

Patch looks good except for what Ted said.

Incorporated review comments. Thanks Ted and Stack.

./Zahoor
Changed the Patch file name to stick to convention.

This message is automatically generated.
Strange.. this patch applies to trunk in my setup and the "TestReplication" test also passes.

@J:
If you look at patch v2 closely, you can see that it is composed of two patch files (line 310).

I suggest renaming TestTableFamilyHandlers.java -> TestTableDeleteFamilyHandler.java because only TableDeleteFamilyHandler is tested.
There're a lot of two (successive) empty lines in this new file.
Please remove redundant empty line.


 * Copyright 2009 The Apache Software Foundation

The above line should be removed from license header.


   // 4 - Check if all the 3 column families exists in FS

'exists' -> 'exist'


  public org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ResourceCheckerJUnitRule cu = new org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ResourceCheckerJUnitRule();

The above line is longer than 100 characters. Please wrap.

Please regenerate patch and attach to this JIRA.

Thanks
For MasterFileSystem.deleteFamily(), if fs.delete() returns false, I think we should raise IOException.

Thanks for the comments. I will incorporate it.
But regarding the two patch situation.. will it not apply if you have two patches in a single patch?
Anyway.. i will make it in to a single patch
Attached a V3 patch incorporating the above comments.
Corrected some spelling mistakes

TestHRegion failed. See https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2669/console


+  public void deleteFamily(HRegionInfo region, byte[] familyName)

Please rename the above method deleteFamilyFromFS().


+      if (fs.delete(delDir, true) == false) {

+      throw new IOException("Could not delete family "

Indent the throw statement to the right by two spaces.


+          + Bytes.toString(familyName) + " from FileSystem for region "

+          + region.getTableNameAsString());

I think getTableNameAsString() shouldn't be used because you want to tell user the name of the region.
For TestTableDeleteFamilyHandler.java:


+ * Copyright 2012 The Apache Software Foundation

Year is not needed in license header.

I wonder what test hung in PreCommit build #2721.

I see this in the console output... I think it takes long time to execute the tests...
Other than that i cant see any errors.

I will go over latest patch one more time and integrate if I don't see major issues.

Integrated to trunk.

Thanks for the patch, J.
